column4: I'm the right person to fix HSBC  says CEO Gulliver
column5: LONDON HSBC  Chief Executive Stuart Gulliver said he was the right person to run Europe's biggest bank and fix problems of the past after British lawmakers berated it for allowing "industrial-scale tax avoidance" at its Swiss arm.

column4: UPDATE 2-I'm the right person to fix HSBC  says CEO Gulliver
column5: * But says he is committed to finishing revamp of bank   (Adds comments from CEO  director  lawmakers  background)

column4: Argentina wants HSBC to repatriate $3.5 billion in offshore funds
column5: BUENOS AIRES/LONDON Argentina wants HSBC Holdings Plc to repatriate $3.5 billion that it says the bank's Argentine branch moved offshore to help clients evade taxes and move capital abroad  the country's tax chief said on Monday.

column4: J&J's Ethicon settles bellwether mesh case mid-trial in West Virginia
column5: Four days into a bellwether trial in West Virginia federal court  Johnson & Johnson's Ethicon Inc has reached a settlement in a lawsuit from a woman who said she was injured by one of its transvaginal mesh devices.

column4: Deals of the day- Mergers and acquisitions
column5: March 9 The following bids  mergers  acquisitions and disposals were reported by 2000 GMT on Monday:

column4: Mall owner Simon pushes rival Macerich to do a deal
column5: Simon Property Group Inc  offered to buy Macerich Co  for $14.39 billion in a deal that would join the No. 1 and No. 3 U.S. shopping mall owners.

column4: UPDATE 3-Mall owner Simon pushes rival Macerich to do a deal
column5: * Macerich shares brush past offer to touch 8-year high   (Adds Macerich's response in paragraph 12  updates share)

column4: Simon offers to buy Macerich for $22.4 bln in cash and stock
column5: March 9 Simon Property Group Inc  an owner of malls and outlet centers  said it had offered to buy real estate investment trust Macerich Co in a cash and stock deal for $22.4 billion including debt.

column4: McDonald's vows 'modern' makeover amid U.S. sales struggle
column5: McDonald's Corp  on Monday vowed to remake itself as a "modern  progressive burger company" after aggressive competition from Chipotle Mexican Grill Inc   Chick-fil-A and myriad "better burger" chains bit into U.S. restaurant sales last month. | Video

column4: Chicken growers set to pay price for no-antibiotic McNugget
column5: CHICAGO/LOS ANGELES McDonald's Corp's decision last week to phase out human antibiotics from its U.S. chicken supply will add to costs of production in a tight-margin business that are likely to be borne mostly by poultry companies. | Video

column5: March  9 McDonald's Corp on Monday vowed to remake itself as a "modern  progressive burger company" after aggressive competition from Chipotle Mexican Grill Inc  Chick-fil-A and myriad "better burger" chains bit into U.S. restaurant sales last month.

column4: McDonald's February restaurant sales down 1.7 pct
column5: March  9 McDonald's Corp's worldwide sales at established restaurants fell 1.7 percent in February as sales in the United States were hurt by "aggressive competitive activity".

column4: RPT - INSIGHT-Chicken growers set to pay price for no-antibiotic McNugget
column5: CHICAGO/LOS ANGELES  March 9 McDonald's Corp's  decision last week to phase out human antibiotics from its U.S. chicken supply will add to costs of production in a tight-margin business that are likely to be borne mostly by poultry companies.

column4: UPDATE 1-ON THE MOVE-Raymond James unit hires two advisers from Morgan Stanley
column5: March 9  Raymond James & Associates  the broker-dealer unit of Raymond James Financial Inc  hired two advisers from Morgan Stanley for its Washington DC office.

column5: March 9  Raymond James & Associates  the broker-dealer unit of Raymond James Financial Inc  hired two advisers from Morgan Stanley for its Washington DC office.

column4: Brazil leads LatAm wider as US Treasury prices recover
column5: NEW YORK  March 9 (IFR) -  Latin American debt markets were largely starting wider Monday led by Brazil as bond prices fail to catch up with an uptick in US Treasury prices following the start of the ECB's asset purchase program today.

column4: EMERGING MARKETS-Brazil's real weakens sharply on political  fiscal concerns
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO  March 9 The Brazilian real tumbled early on Monday in its sixth straight session of losses as investors feared President Dilma Rousseff will lack the political strength to impose austerity measures needed to meet a crucial fiscal goal this year.

column4: U.S. FDA warns of seizure  alcohol risk with Pfizer's Chantix
column5: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration warned on Monday that Pfizer Inc's quit-smoking drug  Chantix  has been associated with seizures and that some patients who drink while taking the drug may become aggressive or black out.

column4: UPDATE 1-U.S. FDA warns of seizure  alcohol risk with Pfizer's Chantix
column5: March 9 The U.S. Food and Drug Administration warned on Monday that Pfizer Inc's quit-smoking drug  Chantix  has been associated with seizures and that some patients who drink while taking the drug may become aggressive or black out.

column4: FDA declines to remove serious warning on Pfizer's Chantix
column5: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration has declined to reduce the severity of its warning about neuropsychiatric side effects associated with Pfizer Inc's  quit-smoking drug Chantix  the agency said on Monday.

column4: U.S. FDA declines to remove serious warning on Pfizer's Chantix
column5: March 9 The U.S. Food and Drug Administration has declined to reduce the severity of its warning about neuropsychiatric side effects associated with Pfizer Inc's  quit-smoking drug Chantix  the agency said on Monday.

column4: Phillips 66 cuts CEO bonus after 2014 share decline
column5: BOSTON  March 9 U.S. oil refiner Phillips 66  cut by 35 percent what it paid Chief Executive Greg Garland last year under its bonus plan  citing market conditions and stock performance.

column4: Prudential's Thiam lined up to replace Dougan at Credit Suisse: FT
column5: Prudential PLC Chief Tidjane Thiam is slated to replace Credit Suisse Group AG's Brady Dougan as Chief Executive  the Financial Times reported  citing people briefed on the matter.

column4: Prudential's Thiam lined up to replace Dougan at Credit Suisse -FT
column5: March 9 Prudential PLC Chief Tidjane Thiam is slated to replace Credit Suisse Group AG's  Brady Dougan as Chief Executive  the Financial Times reported  citing people briefed on the matter.

column5: * Expects savings of 4 bln rand   (Recasts with cracker plans  Eskom talks)

column4: S.Africa's Sasol could expand Louisiana cracker project - CEO
column5: JOHANNESBURG  March 9 South African petrochemicals group Sasol could expand its $8.9 billion cracker project in Louisiana  depending on market conditions  its chief executive said on Monday.

column4: Sasol says aims to maintain 40:60 interim/final dividend split
column5: JOHANNESBURG  March 9 South Africa's petrochemicals group Sasol aims to maintain a 40/60 split of its interim and final dividends so it can be flexible in volatile markets  the group's financial controller Paul Victor said on Monday.   (Reporting by Zandi Shabalala; Editing by James Macharia)

column4: Sasol H1 earnings up on better sales  cuts dividend
column5: JOHANNESBURG  March 9 South African petrochemicals company Sasol reported a 6 percent increase in first-half earnings on Monday  as higher sales and chemical prices offset the impact of falling oil prices.

column5: Sysco Corp extended an interim termination date for closing or scrapping its controversial deal to buy US Foods to May 7  the company said on Monday in a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission.

column4: Telecom Italia CEO confirms plan to list towers unit by summer
column5: ROME  March 9 Telecom Italia Chief Executive Marco Patuano confirmed on Monday plans to list its Italian towers business by the end of the summer  rejecting media speculation the unit could be merged with other operators.

column4: Baring to buy Blackstone's stake in India's CMS for $250 mln-sources
column5: MUMBAI  March 9 Blackstone Group LP has agreed to sell its 57 percent stake in India's CMS Info Systems Ltd to Baring Private Equity (Asia) for $250 million  two sources with direct knowledge of the matter told Reuters.

column4: Charles Schwab must face U.S. lawsuit over bond index fund
column5: A U.S. appeals court on Monday revived a class-action lawsuit accusing Charles Schwab Corp of stuffing risky mortgage-backed securities into a bond index mutual fund  causing the fund to significantly lag its benchmark.

column5: March 9 A U.S. appeals court on Monday revived a class-action lawsuit accusing a unit of Charles Schwab Corp  of mismanaging a bond index mutual fund.

column4: HBO standalone service coming to Apple devices in April
column5: HBO's standalone streaming service will launch on Apple Inc devices next month in time for the season premiere of hit series "Game of Thrones " the network said on Monday  a move to reach millions of viewers who do not subscribe to pay television packages. | Video

column5: United Continental Holdings Inc said on Monday that it expects its quarterly fuel cost to be the same as it reported in an operational update a month ago  including the impact of taxes and cash-settled hedges.

US STOCKS-Futures edge lower  extending recent weakness
column5: NEW YORK  March 9 U.S. stock index futures were lower on Monday  pointing to a continued downtrend on Wall Street as investors continued to question whether an interest rate increase could come sooner than previously expected.
